descriptions: My goal in life is to blog more and tweet classic Simpsons quotes less.
I work as a graphics reporter at the Wall Street Journal. I craft clean code to build interactive graphics and tools.

descriptions.text: I've listed a few of graphics and other things I've made below, but feel free to skip past to my {skills}!

projects.title: Covid-19 Battle to Intensify as Winter Sets In

description.value: Rising Covid-19 caseloads had public health authorities on high alert as the northern hemisphere headed into Winter 2020. One hopeful sign: the southern hemisphere experienced a mild flu season, easing seasonal pressure on hospitals.
To show the change in rates of flu, I designed and developed a series of animated maps. The maps are also scrubbable so readers can flick through the maps at their own pace.
I develop tools that help graphics editors and reporters to produce stunning visuals.
For example, reporters were spending ages combing the ECDC to get daily COVID figures. I made a tool that scrapes and saves the data to a MySQL database, ready for download at the click of a button.
Or, for busy markets days, I developed an app editors could use to create trading charts for markets stories.

projects.title: Europe Got Covid Largely Under Control in the Summer. What Went Wrong?

description.value: The second wave of the COVID crisis hit Europe harder than the first. Policymakers scrambled to keep the virus controlled until  vaccine rollotut, as people returned to their day-to-day lives.
Using d3.js, I build a side-by-side view of Europe, showing clearly how the virus took hold during the second wave.
I also built out a chart showing the huge spike in cases, and was the main developer for the article.
Since 2016 referendum, Brexit has a huge effect on the economy. The Bank of England has raised interest rates, the pound is weak against the dollar, and growth has slowed.
I charted the change in some of the most important economic indicators using D3.js.

projects.title: A City Divided: London's Tribes of Finance Face Off

description.value: In the City of London, opinion splits on whether leaving the EU will be a boon or the end of finance as we know it.
The Wall Street Journal interviewed five financiers to find out what Brexit means for them.
Using reactive JavaScript library RxJS, I put together a package that tracked player state across videos.
